etymology.description: 子(子) (zǐ, "son") + 系(系) (xì, "continue") = continuation of a lineage -> grandson
etymology.interpretation: The character 孫(孫) (sūn, "grandson") represents a continuation of the family line, emphasizing the passage of descent from son to grandson.
etymology.simplification: 孫(孫) was simplified to 孙(孫) by replacing 系(系) with 小(小) (xiǎo, "small") while keeping 子(子) intact.

examples.chinese: 他是我的孙子(他是我的孫子)。
家族中有很多孙(家族中有很多孫)，传承着祖先的智慧(傳承著祖先的智慧)。
examples.pinyin: Jiāzú zhōng yǒu hěn duō sūn, chuánchéng zhe zǔxiān de zhìhuì.
examples.english: There are many descendants in the family, inheriting the wisdom of their ancestors.

examples.chinese: 那位老人骄傲地说(那位老人驕傲地說)，他的孙将来会成大器(他的孫將來會成大器)。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi lǎorén jiāo'ào de shuō, tā de sūn jiānglái huì chéng dàqì.
examples.english: The old man said proudly that his grandson will achieve great success in the future.
